org.jeo.raster

Class RasterQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jeo.raster.RasterQuery

  • public class RasterQuery
extends Object
    Describes a query against a RasterDataset dataset.
    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, Boundless

    • Method Detail

      • bands

        public RasterQuery bands(int band,
                int... bands)
        Sets the bands to read from the raster dataset.

        Specifying null or an empty array means all bands.

        Parameters:
        bands - Band indexes (0 based).
        Returns:
        This object.

      • bands

        public RasterQuery bands(Integer[] bands)
        Sets the bands to read from the raster dataset.

        Specifying null or an empty array means all bands.

        Parameters:
        bands - Band indexes (0 based).
        Returns:
        This object.

      • bands

        public int[] bands()
        The bands to read from the raster dataset.
        See Also:
        bands(int,int...)

      • bounds

        public RasterQuery bounds(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Envelope bounds)
        Sets the bounds constraint of the query.

        The bounds should be interpreted in terms of crs(). If no crs has been set the bounds should be interpreted in terms of the native crs of the data being queried.

        Parameters:
        bounds - The query bounds, specifying null means the bounds of the entire dataset.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • bounds

        public com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Envelope bounds()
        Bounds constraints on the query, may be null meaning no bounds constraint.
        See Also:
        bounds(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Envelope)

      • crs

        public RasterQuery crs(org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs)
        Sets the crs of the query.

        Datasets handling queries must check this relative to the native crs to determine if re-projection must occur.

      • crs

        public org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs()
        The query crs, may be null meaning same crs as the data being queried.
        See Also:
        crs(org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem)

      • size

        public RasterQuery size(int width,
               int height)
        Sets the target size of the raster to be read.
        Parameters:
        width - Raster width.
        height - Raster height.

      • size

        public RasterQuery size(Dimension size)
        Sets the target size of the raster to be read.
        Parameters:
        size - Raster dimensions.

      • size

        public Dimension size()
        Target size for the raster being read.
        See Also:

      • datatype

        public RasterQuery datatype(DataType datatype)
        Sets the type of the returned buffer from a raster query.
        Parameters:
        datatype - The buffer type.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • datatype

        public DataType datatype()
        The type of the returned buffer from a raster query.

        Raster datasets are expected to pack data from all bands being query into a single buffer element of this type.
